intro: Crotalaria socotrana, commonly known as Socotra crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and rocky environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Crotalaria socotrana is also notable for its unique morphology, which reflects its evolutionary adaptation to the specific ecological conditions of Socotra.
